intro: Spergula pentandra var. chieusseana, commonly known as the Chieussean sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and linear, succulent leaves. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or maritime environments. It is noted for its ability to tolerate saline conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
